result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Zakaree Latrell Chatman

records.addlTxt:
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4. 
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Zakaree Latrell Chatman appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Meera L Al-Henaey appeared by video for Zakaree Latrell Chatman.  Attorney Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 

Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Indigency hearing scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.

Defendant Zakaree Latrell Chatman not in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Matter scheduled for Pretrial Conference.  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO COMMISSIONER.  Court takes no action as to bail.
No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Zakaree Latrell Chatman in court.  Sara Beth Hill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel. Defendant does not qualify for Public Defender representation. Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 30.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 20, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
